SUMMARY: REQUIRED | OPTIONAL DETAIL: ELEMENT

de.fu.weave.annotation
Annotation Type Action

@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Target(value=METHOD)
@Documented
public @interface Action

Denotes a Method as an action accessible via Web by a given name.

This annotation is applicable to methods in a Module. The annotated methods must follow these rules:

  1. The first parameter MUST be of the type String[]
  2. All other paramters must be annotated using Arg.
  3. The annotated method MUST be public

Since:
Iteration2
Author:
Julian Fleischer

Required Element Summary
 java.lang.String template
          The name of the template to be used by this action
 
Optional Element Summary
 java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.Exception>[] handles
          Exceptions to be left to the Template.
 java.lang.String name
          The name of the action.
 java.lang.String requiresPrivilege
          The name of a permission required to execute this action.
 

Element Detail

template

public abstract java.lang.String template
The name of the template to be used by this action

Exactly one template needs to be specified. The Template is automatically loaded during initialization of the Servlet. If the template does not exist or if contains errors (so that it can not be compiled) an Exception will be thrown by the TemplateManager which attempted to load the Template. If that again happens during initialization of a Controller which is loading its Modules, the initialization will fail.

Returns:
the Name of the template.
Since:
Iteration2

handles

public abstract java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.Exception>[] handles
Exceptions to be left to the Template.

Any Exceptions listed here will catched by the Controller of the Actions Module and passed to the Template Engine, whereas the Controller would handle it otherwise. The Exception will be added as an element "Exception" in the main namespace.

Returns:
An array of Exceptions-Classes ( {NameOfException.class, ...})
Since:
Iteration2
Default:
{}

name

public abstract java.lang.String name
The name of the action.

The action will be accessible via the name given here. Naturally this needs to be a unique identifier, therefore the Controller will throw an Exception when attempting to load a Module that defines a name twice. Typically the action will be located at ///

If no name is given at all (which defaults to the empty string) the action is the default action. This arises logically from the semantics of the path itself. By convention the name of the annotated method (it's Java name) should be "_default".

NOTE: You may specify any name possible here, but try to choose a simple name which can be remembered and typed easily, since it identifies the action in the world wide web (via its domain and path).

Returns:
The name of the action
Since:
Iteration2
Default:
""

requiresPrivilege

public abstract java.lang.String requiresPrivilege
The name of a permission required to execute this action.

This optional value defaults to the empty string, which means: no permission required. If it is not the empty string (that is, when its length() is greather than zero) the Controller automatically checks if the current user has the specified Permission and deny the execution of the action.

Since permissions may be bound to a certain target it is possible to mark one parameter as that target using Arg.isTarget(). If such a Parameter exists the execution is granted only if the user is allowed to do the associated action on the target given by the content of the annotated param.

Returns:
the Name of the required permission, or the empty string
Since:
Iteration2
Default:
""
